review_title: Great Mission, Not So Great Leadership
pros: The mission of the organization is vital. Especially at a time when we are seeing an increase in suicides among young adults. I met some of the most talented and passionate colleagues while working at Active Minds. Strong foundation and individual giving support, which means they are resourced. They are taking steps to work on inequalities within the organization by hiring their first VP of Equity.
cons: The leadership structure, where the Chief officers report to the Chief Operating Officer instead of the Executive Director/Founder, is odd. While the Founder continues to be the face of the organization, she seemed far removed from the day-to-day operations and didn't seem to have a complete picture of the staff's experiences. The then Chief Development & Marketing Officer lacked great leadership skills and a foundational understanding of how her white womanhood + privilege was weaponized against her marginalized staff.
